page.title: 11CHRIST CHURCH,OVER WYRESDALE
page.content: There is evidence of a chapel here in 1370 supported by John o'Gaunt. The stipend of Â£4 which he decreed should be paid to the Chaplain is still paid by the Queen to the present incumbent. The church was rebuilt in 1733. It lies about a kilometre west of Abbeystead itself and is a focus of footpaths leading from the surrounding farms.It has been named the Shepherds' Church and a bar with hooks on which shepherds may hang their crooks is found in the porch. All the stained glass windows, each given in memory of a member of the Molyneux family depict a scene with sheep. Philip Molyneux, 4th Earl of Sefton was responsible for the last major restoration in 1894 but a new heating system was installed in 1985. A 'Breeches' Bible (16th century Geneva Bible) is kept in the church. .
